title: AWS Glue
description: AWS Glue Defines the public endpoint for the AWS Glue service.

BatchCreatePartition.title: BatchCreatePartition
BatchCreatePartition.description: Creates one or more partitions in a batch operation.

BatchDeleteConnection.title: BatchDeleteConnection
BatchDeleteConnection.description: Deletes a list of connection definitions from the Data Catalog.

BatchDeletePartition.title: BatchDeletePartition
BatchDeletePartition.description: Deletes one or more partitions in a batch operation.

BatchDeleteTable.title: BatchDeleteTable
BatchDeleteTable.description:
Deletes multiple tables at once.

After completing this operation, you will no longer have access to the table
versions and partitions that belong to the deleted table. AWS Glue deletes these
"orphaned" resources asynchronously in a timely manner, at the discretion of the
service.

To ensure immediate deletion of all related resources, before calling 
BatchDeleteTable, use DeleteTableVersion or BatchDeleteTableVersion, and 
DeletePartition or BatchDeletePartition, to delete any resources that belong to
the table.

BatchDeleteTableVersion.title: BatchDeleteTableVersion
BatchDeleteTableVersion.description: Deletes a specified batch of versions of a table.

BatchGetCrawlers.title: BatchGetCrawlers
BatchGetCrawlers.description: Returns a list of resource metadata for a given list of crawler names. After calling the ListCrawlers operation, you can call this operation to access the data to which you have been granted permissions to based on tags.

BatchGetDevEndpoints.title: BatchGetDevEndpoints
BatchGetDevEndpoints.description: Returns a list of resource metadata for a given list of DevEndpoint names. After calling the ListDevEndpoints operation, you can call this operation to access the data to which you have been granted permissions. This operation supports all IAM permissions, including permission conditions that uses tags.

BatchGetJobs.title: BatchGetJobs
BatchGetJobs.description: Returns a list of resource metadata for a given list of job names. After calling the ListJobs operation, you can call this operation to access the data to which you have been granted permissions. This operation supports all IAM permissions, including permission conditions that uses tags.

BatchGetPartition.title: BatchGetPartition
BatchGetPartition.description: Retrieves partitions in a batch request.

BatchGetTriggers.title: BatchGetTriggers
BatchGetTriggers.description: Returns a list of resource metadata for a given list of trigger names. After calling the ListTriggers operation, you can call this operation to access the data to which you have been granted permissions. This operation supports all IAM permissions, including permission conditions that uses tags.

BatchStopJobRun.title: BatchStopJobRun
BatchStopJobRun.description: Stops one or more job runs for a specified job definition.

CreateClassifier.title: CreateClassifier
CreateClassifier.description: Creates a classifier in the user's account. This may be a GrokClassifier, an XMLClassifier, or abbrev JsonClassifier, depending on which field of the request is present.

CreateConnection.title: CreateConnection
CreateConnection.description: Creates a connection definition in the Data Catalog.

CreateCrawler.title: CreateCrawler
CreateCrawler.description: Creates a new crawler with specified targets, role, configuration, and optional schedule. At least one crawl target must be specified, in the s3Targets field, the jdbcTargets field, or the DynamoDBTargets field.

CreateDatabase.title: CreateDatabase
CreateDatabase.description: Creates a new database in a Data Catalog.

CreateScript.title: CreateScript
CreateScript.description: Transforms a directed acyclic graph (DAG) into code.

CreateTable.title: CreateTable
CreateTable.description: Creates a new table definition in the Data Catalog.

CreateUserDefinedFunction.title: CreateUserDefinedFunction
CreateUserDefinedFunction.description: Creates a new function definition in the Data Catalog.

DeleteClassifier.title: DeleteClassifier
DeleteClassifier.description: Removes a classifier from the Data Catalog.

DeleteConnection.title: DeleteConnection
DeleteConnection.description: Deletes a connection from the Data Catalog.

DeleteCrawler.title: DeleteCrawler
DeleteCrawler.description: Removes a specified crawler from the Data Catalog, unless the crawler state is RUNNING.

DeleteDatabase.title: DeleteDatabase
DeleteDatabase.description:
Removes a specified Database from a Data Catalog.

After completing this operation, you will no longer have access to the tables
(and all table versions and partitions that might belong to the tables) and the
user-defined functions in the deleted database. AWS Glue deletes these
"orphaned" resources asynchronously in a timely manner, at the discretion of the
service.

To ensure immediate deletion of all related resources, before calling 
DeleteDatabase, use DeleteTableVersion or BatchDeleteTableVersion, 
DeletePartition or BatchDeletePartition, DeleteUserDefinedFunction, and 
DeleteTable or BatchDeleteTable, to delete any resources that belong to the
database.

DeleteJob.title: DeleteJob
DeleteJob.description: Deletes a specified job definition. If the job definition is not found, no exception is thrown.

DeleteTable.title: DeleteTable
DeleteTable.description:
Removes a table definition from the Data Catalog.

After completing this operation, you will no longer have access to the table
versions and partitions that belong to the deleted table. AWS Glue deletes these
"orphaned" resources asynchronously in a timely manner, at the discretion of the
service.

To ensure immediate deletion of all related resources, before calling 
DeleteTable, use DeleteTableVersion or BatchDeleteTableVersion, and 
DeletePartition or BatchDeletePartition, to delete any resources that belong to
the table.

DeleteTableVersion.title: DeleteTableVersion
DeleteTableVersion.description: Deletes a specified version of a table.

DeleteTrigger.title: DeleteTrigger
DeleteTrigger.description: Deletes a specified trigger. If the trigger is not found, no exception is thrown.

DeleteUserDefinedFunction.title: DeleteUserDefinedFunction
DeleteUserDefinedFunction.description: Deletes an existing function definition from the Data Catalog.

GetCatalogImportStatus.title: GetCatalogImportStatus
GetCatalogImportStatus.description: Retrieves the status of a migration operation.

GetClassifiers.title: GetClassifiers
GetClassifiers.description: Lists all classifier objects in the Data Catalog.

GetConnection.title: GetConnection
GetConnection.description: Retrieves a connection definition from the Data Catalog.

GetConnections.title: GetConnections
GetConnections.description: Retrieves a list of connection definitions from the Data Catalog.

GetCrawler.title: GetCrawler
GetCrawler.description: Retrieves metadata for a specified crawler.

GetCrawlers.title: GetCrawlers
GetCrawlers.description: Retrieves metadata for all crawlers defined in the customer account.

GetDataCatalogEncryptionSettings.title: GetDataCatalogEncryptionSettings
GetDataCatalogEncryptionSettings.description: Retrieves the security configuration for a specified catalog.

GetDatabase.title: GetDatabase
GetDatabase.description: Retrieves the definition of a specified database.

GetDatabases.title: GetDatabases
GetDatabases.description: Retrieves all Databases defined in a given Data Catalog.

GetDataflowGraph.title: GetDataflowGraph
GetDataflowGraph.description: Transforms a Python script into a directed acyclic graph (DAG).

GetDevEndpoint.title: GetDevEndpoint
GetDevEndpoint.description:
Retrieves information about a specified DevEndpoint.

When you create a development endpoint in a virtual private cloud (VPC), AWS
Glue returns only a private IP address, and the public IP address field is not
populated. When you create a non-VPC development endpoint, AWS Glue returns only
a public IP address.

GetDevEndpoints.title: GetDevEndpoints
GetDevEndpoints.description:
Retrieves all the DevEndpoints in this AWS account.

When you create a development endpoint in a virtual private cloud (VPC), AWS
Glue returns only a private IP address and the public IP address field is not
populated. When you create a non-VPC development endpoint, AWS Glue returns only
a public IP address.

GetJobRun.title: GetJobRun
GetJobRun.description: Retrieves the metadata for a given job run.

GetJobRuns.title: GetJobRuns
GetJobRuns.description: Retrieves metadata for all runs of a given job definition.

GetPartition.title: GetPartition
GetPartition.description: Retrieves information about a specified partition.

GetPartitions.title: GetPartitions
GetPartitions.description: Retrieves information about the partitions in a table.

GetPlan.title: GetPlan
GetPlan.description: Gets code to perform a specified mapping.

GetSecurityConfigurations.title: GetSecurityConfigurations
GetSecurityConfigurations.description: Retrieves a list of all security configurations.

GetTable.title: GetTable
GetTable.description: Retrieves the Table definition in a Data Catalog for a specified table.

GetTableVersion.title: GetTableVersion
GetTableVersion.description: Retrieves a specified version of a table.

GetTableVersions.title: GetTableVersions
GetTableVersions.description: Retrieves a list of strings that identify available versions of a specified table.

GetTables.title: GetTables
GetTables.description: Retrieves the definitions of some or all of the tables in a given Database.

GetTags.title: GetTags
GetTags.description: Retrieves a list of tags associated with a resource.

GetTrigger.title: GetTrigger
GetTrigger.description: Retrieves the definition of a trigger.

GetTriggers.title: GetTriggers
GetTriggers.description: Gets all the triggers associated with a job.

GetUserDefinedFunction.title: GetUserDefinedFunction
GetUserDefinedFunction.description: Retrieves a specified function definition from the Data Catalog.

GetUserDefinedFunctions.title: GetUserDefinedFunctions
GetUserDefinedFunctions.description: Retrieves a multiple function definitions from the Data Catalog.

ImportCatalogToGlue.title: ImportCatalogToGlue
ImportCatalogToGlue.description: Imports an existing Athena Data Catalog to AWS Glue

ListCrawlers.title: ListCrawlers
ListCrawlers.description:
Retrieves the names of all crawler resources in this AWS account, or the
resources with the specified tag. This operation allows you to see which
resources are available in your account, and their names.

This operation takes the optional Tags field which you can use as a filter on
the response so that tagged resources can be retrieved as a group. If you choose
to use tags filtering, only resources with the tag will be retrieved.

ListDevEndpoints.title: ListDevEndpoints
ListDevEndpoints.description:
Retrieves the names of all DevEndpoint resources in this AWS account, or the
resources with the specified tag. This operation allows you to see which
resources are available in your account, and their names.

This operation takes the optional Tags field which you can use as a filter on
the response so that tagged resources can be retrieved as a group. If you choose
to use tags filtering, only resources with the tag will be retrieved.

ListJobs.title: ListJobs
ListJobs.description:
Retrieves the names of all job resources in this AWS account, or the resources
with the specified tag. This operation allows you to see which resources are
available in your account, and their names.

This operation takes the optional Tags field which you can use as a filter on
the response so that tagged resources can be retrieved as a group. If you choose
to use tags filtering, only resources with the tag will be retrieved.

ListTriggers.title: ListTriggers
ListTriggers.description:
Retrieves the names of all trigger resources in this AWS account, or the
resources with the specified tag. This operation allows you to see which
resources are available in your account, and their names.

This operation takes the optional Tags field which you can use as a filter on
the response so that tagged resources can be retrieved as a group. If you choose
to use tags filtering, only resources with the tag will be retrieved.

PutDataCatalogEncryptionSettings.title: PutDataCatalogEncryptionSettings
PutDataCatalogEncryptionSettings.description: Sets the security configuration for a specified catalog. After the configuration has been set, the specified encryption is applied to every catalog write thereafter.

PutResourcePolicy.title: PutResourcePolicy
PutResourcePolicy.description: Sets the Data Catalog resource policy for access control.

StartCrawler.title: StartCrawler
StartCrawler.description: Starts a crawl using the specified crawler, regardless of what is scheduled. If the crawler is already running, returns a CrawlerRunningException.

StartCrawlerSchedule.title: StartCrawlerSchedule
StartCrawlerSchedule.description: Changes the schedule state of the specified crawler to SCHEDULED, unless the crawler is already running or the schedule state is already SCHEDULED.

StartJobRun.title: StartJobRun
StartJobRun.description: Starts a job run using a job definition.

StartTrigger.title: StartTrigger
StartTrigger.description: Starts an existing trigger. See Triggering Jobs for information about how different types of trigger are started.

StopCrawler.title: StopCrawler
StopCrawler.description: If the specified crawler is running, stops the crawl.

StopCrawlerSchedule.title: StopCrawlerSchedule
StopCrawlerSchedule.description: Sets the schedule state of the specified crawler to NOT_SCHEDULED, but does not stop the crawler if it is already running.

TagResource.title: TagResource
TagResource.description: Adds tags to a resource. A tag is a label you can assign to an AWS resource. In AWS Glue, you can tag only certain resources. For information about what resources you can tag, see AWS Tags in AWS Glue.

UpdateClassifier.title: UpdateClassifier
UpdateClassifier.description: Modifies an existing classifier (a GrokClassifier, XMLClassifier, or JsonClassifier, depending on which field is present).

UpdateConnection.title: UpdateConnection
UpdateConnection.description: Updates a connection definition in the Data Catalog.

UpdateCrawler.title: UpdateCrawler
UpdateCrawler.description: Updates a crawler. If a crawler is running, you must stop it using StopCrawler before updating it.

UpdateCrawlerSchedule.title: UpdateCrawlerSchedule
UpdateCrawlerSchedule.description: Updates the schedule of a crawler using a cron expression.

UpdateDatabase.title: UpdateDatabase
UpdateDatabase.description: Updates an existing database definition in a Data Catalog.

UpdateTable.title: UpdateTable
UpdateTable.description: Updates a metadata table in the Data Catalog.

UpdateUserDefinedFunction.title: UpdateUserDefinedFunction
UpdateUserDefinedFunction.description: Updates an existing function definition in the Data Catalog.
